# Measurement.AttributedStyle.ByteCount

**Structure**

A format style that converts byte counts into attributed strings.

## Declaration

```swift
struct ByteCount
```

## Overview

Use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/ByteCount/attributed] modifier on a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/ByteCount] instance to create a format style of this type.

The attributed strings that this fomat style creates contain attributes from the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/AttributeScopes/FoundationAttributes/NumberFormatAttributes] attribute scope. Use these attributes to determine which runs of the attributed string represent different parts of the formatted value.

## Creating an attributed byte count format style

- **init(style:allowedUnits:spellsOutZero:includesActualByteCount:locale:)**: Initializes an attributed byte count format style.

## Accessing style properties

- **allowedUnits**: The units the format style can use to express the byte count.
- **Measurement.AttributedStyle.ByteCount.Units**: The type the measurement format style uses to represent byte-counting units.
- **spellsOutZero**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the format style should spell out zero-byte values as text.
- **includesActualByteCount**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the format style should include the exact byte count, in addition to expressing it in terms of units.
- **style**: The style of byte count to express, such as memory or file system storage.
- **Measurement.AttributedStyle.ByteCount.Style**: The type used to represent the style of the formatted byte count.
- **locale**: The locale to use to format the numeric part of the byte count.

## Creating attributed strings

- **attributed**: An attributed format style based on the byte count format style.

## Conforms To

- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- FormatStyle
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
